title: Mith grapple

properties.name: description
properties.value: The mith grapple is an item that is used for certain Agility shortcuts and crossbow shortcuts for achievement diaries. The grapple is made by attaching a mith grapple tip (59 Smithing) to a mithril bolt (59 Fletching) and then finally used on a rope. Alternatively, a Fletching cape or max cape can be searched for a mith grapple and bronze crossbow three times a day. The grapple can be fired using any crossbow and is carried in the ammunition slot. Both the grapple and crossbow must be equipped in order for it to work; simply having them in the inventory will not suffice.

The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Mithril grapple
This article is about finished mith grapple. For the unfinished variant, see Mith grapple (unf).
Mith grapple

Item ID9419

The mith grapple is an item that is used for certain Agility shortcuts and crossbow shortcuts for achievement diaries. The grapple is made by attaching a mith grapple tip (59 Smithing) to a mithril bolt (59 Fletching) and then finally used on a rope. Alternatively, a Fletching cape or max cape can be searched for a mith grapple and bronze crossbow three times a day. The grapple can be fired using any crossbow and is carried in the ammunition slot. Both the grapple and crossbow must be equipped in order for it to work; simply having them in the inventory will not suffice.

Besides needing a certain Agility level for mithril grapple shortcuts, players also need a certain Ranged and Strength level to cross. Armadyl's section of the God Wars Dungeon is the sole exception to this rule; only level 70 Ranged is required to swing across the chasm found there.

There is a 1/25[1] chance of the grapple being destroyed upon usage; when this occurs, the message box states "After untying the rope, you find that your grapple is broken and useless.".

An unlimited supply of mith grapples can be found via a crate located in Armadyl's Eyrie, due south of the grapple spot. However, the player requires a mith grapple to access the Eyrie. The "drop trick" can be utilised here to obtain multiple grapples, as players can only have one on their character at a time; be it in their inventory or equipped. This does not include grapples stored in the bank.

[[File:Mith grapple detail.png|left|120px]]
The '''mith grapple''' is an item that is used for certain [[Agility shortcuts]] and [[All_achievements#Crossbow_shortcuts|crossbow shortcuts for achievement diaries]]. The grapple is made by attaching a [[mith grapple tip]] (59 [[Smithing]]) to a [[mithril bolt]] (59 [[Fletching]]) and then finally used on a [[rope]]. Alternatively, a [[Fletching cape]] or [[max cape]] can be searched for a mith grapple and [[bronze crossbow]] three times a day. The grapple can be fired using any crossbow and is carried in the [[ammunition slot]]. Both the grapple and crossbow ''must ''be equipped in order for it to work; simply having them in the inventory will not suffice.

Besides needing a certain [[Agility]] level for mithril grapple shortcuts, players also need a certain [[Ranged]] and [[Strength]] level to cross. [[Armadyl]]'s [[Armadyl's Eyrie|section]] of the [[God Wars Dungeon]] is the sole exception to this rule; only level 70 Ranged is required to swing across the chasm found there.

There is a 1/25{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1051989319781498880|date=15 October 2018|archiveurl=https://archive.is/xcMO4|archivedate=28 May 2020|quote=1/25, which I think is standard for such short-cuts and access routes.}} chance of the grapple being destroyed upon usage; when this occurs, the message box states ''"After untying the rope, you find that your grapple is broken and useless."''.

An unlimited supply of mith grapples can be found via a crate located in [[Armadyl's Eyrie]], due south of the grapple spot. However, the player requires a mith grapple to access the Eyrie. The "[[drop trick]]" can be utilised here to obtain multiple grapples, as players can only have one on their character at a time; be it in their inventory or equipped. This does not include grapples stored in the [[bank]].
